# List of NHL records (individual)

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

This is a list of **individual records** recognized by the [National Hockey
League](/wiki/National_Hockey_League "National Hockey League") through the end
of the [2016–17 NHL season](/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_NHL_season "2016–17 NHL
season").

##
Seasons[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_NHL_records_\(individual\)&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Seasons")]

  * Most seasons: [Gordie Howe](/wiki/Gordie_Howe "Gordie Howe") (1946–47 to 1970–1971; 1979–1980) and [Chris Chelios](/wiki/Chris_Chelios "Chris Chelios") (1983–84 to 2009–10, except for the [2004–05 NHL lock-out](/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_NHL_lock-out "2004–05 NHL lock-out")), **26**
  * Most playoff seasons: [Chris Chelios](/wiki/Chris_Chelios "Chris Chelios"), **24** (1983–84 to 2008–09, except for 1997–98 and the [2004–05 NHL lock-out](/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_NHL_lock-out "2004–05 NHL lock-out") year)
  * Most consecutive playoff seasons: [Larry Robinson](/wiki/Larry_Robinson "Larry Robinson"), (1972–73 to 1991–92) and [Nicklas Lidstrom](/wiki/Nicklas_Lidstr%C3%B6m "Nicklas Lidström"), (1991–92 to 2011–12, except for the [2004–05 NHL lock-out](/wiki/2004%E2%80%9305_NHL_lock-out "2004–05 NHL lock-out")), **20**[1]

##
Games[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_NHL_records_\(individual\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Games")]

  * Most games: [Gordie Howe](/wiki/Gordie_Howe "Gordie Howe"), **1,767**
  * Most games, including playoffs: [Mark Messier](/wiki/Mark_Messier "Mark Messier"), **1,992**
  * Most playoff games: [Chris Chelios](/wiki/Chris_Chelios "Chris Chelios"), **266**
  * Most games played in a single NHL season, not including playoffs: [Jimmy Carson](/wiki/Jimmy_Carson "Jimmy Carson") (1992–93) and [Bob Kudelski](/wiki/Bob_Kudelski "Bob Kudelski") (1993–94), **86**
  * Most consecutive games: [Doug Jarvis](/wiki/Doug_Jarvis "Doug Jarvis") (October 8, 1975 – October 10, 1987), **964**
  * Most consecutive games by a defenceman: [Jay Bouwmeester](/wiki/Jay_Bouwmeester "Jay Bouwmeester"), **737**[2]
  * Oldest player to play a game: [Gordie Howe](/wiki/Gordie_Howe "Gordie Howe"), **52 years, 11 days**
  * Most games by a coach in the Stanley Cup Final: [Dick Irvin](/wiki/Dick_Irvin "Dick Irvin") (Chicago (5), Toronto (29), Montreal (43)), **77**
  * Most games played in the Finals: [Red Kelly](/wiki/Red_Kelly "Red Kelly") (Detroit (37), Toronto (28)), [Henri Richard](/wiki/Henri_Richard "Henri Richard") (Montreal), **65**
  * Most games won by a coach in the Stanley Cup Finals: [Scotty Bowman](/wiki/Scotty_Bowman "Scotty Bowman") (Montreal (20), Pittsburgh (4), Detroit (12)), **36**

## Stanley
Cup[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_NHL_records_\(individual\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Stanley Cup")]

  * Most Stanley Cup wins, as a player: [Henri Richard](/wiki/Henri_Richard "Henri Richard") Montreal Canadiens, (1956, 57, 58, 59, 60, 65, 66, 68, 69, 71, 73) **11**
  * Most Stanley Cup wins, as a non-player: [Scotty Bowman](/wiki/Scotty_Bowman "Scotty Bowman") (Montreal: 1973, 76, 77, 78, 79 (Coach); Pittsburgh: 1991 (Director of Player Development-Recruitment), 1992 (Head Coach); Detroit: 1997, 98, 2002 (Head Coach), 2008 (Consultant); Chicago: 2010, 13, 15 (Sr. Advisor) **14**
  * Most Stanley Cup wins, combined player or non-player: [Jean Beliveau](/wiki/Jean_B%C3%A9liveau "Jean Béliveau"), Montreal Canadiens (Player: 1956, 57, 58, 59, 60, 65, 66, 68, 69, 71; Sr. Vice President: 1973, 76, 77, 78, 79, 86, 93), **17**

**Won the Stanley Cup with the highest number of different teams**

  * Player - [Jack Marshall](/wiki/Jack_Marshall_\(ice_hockey\) "Jack Marshall \(ice hockey\)") (Winnipeg Victorias 1901, Montreal AAA 1902, 1903, Montreal Wanderers 1907, 1910, Toronto Blueshirts 1914) and [Hap Holmes](/wiki/Hap_Holmes "Hap Holmes") (Toronto Blueshirts 1914, Seattle Metropolitans 1917, Toronto Arenas 1918, Victoria Cougars 1925), **4**
  * Player/Non-Player - [Al Arbour](/wiki/Al_Arbour "Al Arbour") (Player: Detroit 1954, Chicago 1961, Toronto 1962, 1964; Coach: New York Islanders 1980, 81, 82, 83), **4**
  * Non-Player - [Tommy Gorman](/wiki/Tommy_Gorman "Tommy Gorman") (Ottawa Senators: 1920, 1921, 1923 (Manager); Chicago: 1934 (Manager/Coach); Montreal Maroons: 1935 (Manager/Coach); Montreal Canadiens: 1944, 1946 (Manager) and [Scotty Bowman](/wiki/Scotty_Bowman "Scotty Bowman") (Montreal: 1973, 76, 77, 78, 79 (Coach); Pittsburgh: 1991 (Director of Player Development-Recruitment), 1992 (Head Coach); Detroit: 1997, 98, 2002 (Head Coach), 2008 (Consultant); Chicago: 2010, 13, 15 (Sr. Advisor) **4**

  * Most [Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophies](/wiki/Maurice_%22Rocket%22_Richard_Trophy "Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophy"): [Alexander Ovechkin](/wiki/Alexander_Ovechkin "Alexander Ovechkin"), **6**[7]
  * Most consecutive Maurice "Rocket" Richard Trophies: [Alexander Ovechkin](/wiki/Alexander_Ovechkin "Alexander Ovechkin"), **4**

  * Most consecutive Frank J. Selke Trophies: [Bob Gainey](/wiki/Bob_Gainey "Bob Gainey") **4**
  * Most [Lady Byng Trophies](/wiki/Lady_Byng_Trophy "Lady Byng Trophy"): [Frank Boucher](/wiki/Frank_Boucher "Frank Boucher"), **7**[10]
  * Most consecutive Lady Byng Trophies: [Frank Boucher](/wiki/Frank_Boucher "Frank Boucher") and [Pavel Datsyuk](/wiki/Pavel_Datsyuk "Pavel Datsyuk"), **4**
  * Most [William M Jennings Trophies](/wiki/William_M._Jennings_Trophy "William M. Jennings Trophy"): [Patrick Roy](/wiki/Patrick_Roy "Patrick Roy"), [Martin Brodeur](/wiki/Martin_Brodeur "Martin Brodeur"), **5**[11]
  * Most consecutive William M Jennings Trophies: [Patrick Roy](/wiki/Patrick_Roy "Patrick Roy") and [Brian Hayward](/wiki/Brian_Hayward "Brian Hayward"), **3**
  * Most [Vezina Trophies](/wiki/Vezina_Trophy "Vezina Trophy"): [Jacques Plante](/wiki/Jacques_Plante "Jacques Plante"), **7**[12]
  * Most consecutive Vezina Trophies: [Jacques Plante](/wiki/Jacques_Plante "Jacques Plante"), **5**
  * Most [Jack Adams Awards](/wiki/Jack_Adams_Award "Jack Adams Award"): [Pat Burns](/wiki/Pat_Burns "Pat Burns"), **3**[13]
  * Most consecutive Jack Adams Awards: [Jacques Demers](/wiki/Jacques_Demers "Jacques Demers"), **2**
